page.title: 11WORSHIP IN GARTMORE
page.content: Gartmore has a small{village church} with an old burial ground behind it. The minister also holds services in Buchlyvie, where he lives. There are seats for 300 people and an electric organ. There used to be a Free Church, but it is now used as the Village Hall.{Sunday School}has 7 teachers on a rota basis and about 20 children. They meet in the school each Sunday from 10.15-11.00 am. Roman Catholics go to Buchlyvie for services with Instructions in Gartmore school. On 10/12/84 the {Way College of {Biblical Research}moved into Gartmore House, with 5 full-time staff and at present 28 students from all over the world. As well as Bible study, the students do practical skills. The main building is residential and the John Knox centre, which was formally St. Ninians is for studying.
